segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 46
segments.en: Linked Discourses 46

segments.pli: 6. Sākacchavagga
segments.en: 6. Discussion

segments.pli: 53. Aggisutta
segments.en: 53. Fire

segments.pli: Atha kho sambahulā bhikkhū pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṃ piṇḍāya pavisiṃsu.
segments.en: Then several mendicants robed up in the morning and, taking their bowls and robes, entered Sāvatthī for alms.

segments.pli: (Pariyāyasuttasadisaṃ.)
segments.en: (The same as the previous discourse.)

segments.pli: “Evaṃvādino, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evamassu vacanīyā:
segments.en: “Mendicants, when wanderers who follow other paths say this, you should say to them:

segments.pli: ‘yasmiṃ, āvuso, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, katamesaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bojjhaṅgānaṃ akālo bhāvanāya, katamesaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bojjhaṅgānaṃ kālo bhāvanāya?
segments.en: ‘Reverends, which awakening factors should not be developed when the mind is sluggish? And which awakening factors should be developed at that time?

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ panāvuso, samaye uddhataṃ cittaṃ hoti, katamesaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bojjhaṅgānaṃ akālo bhāvanāya, katamesaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bojjhaṅgānaṃ kālo bhāvanāyā’ti?
segments.en: Which awakening factors should not be developed when the mind is restless? And which awakening factors should be developed at that time?’

segments.pli: Evaṃ puṭṭhā, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā na ceva sampāyissanti, uttariñca vighātaṃ āpajjissanti.
segments.en: Questioned like this, the wanderers who follow other paths would be stumped, and, in addition, would get frustrated.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Yathā taṃ, bhikkhave, avisayasmiṃ.
segments.en: Because they’re out of their element.

segments.pli: Nāhaṃ taṃ, bhikkhave, passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya yo imesaṃ pañhānaṃ veyyākaraṇena cittaṃ ārādheyya, aññatra tathāgatena vā tathāgatasāvakena vā ito vā pana sutvā.
segments.en: I don’t see anyone in this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—who could provide a satisfying answer to these questions except for the Realized One or his disciple or someone who has heard it from them.

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, akālo tasmiṃ samaye passaddhisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo samādhisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo upekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya.
segments.en: When the mind is sluggish, it’s the wrong time to develop the awakening factors of tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Līnaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ taṃ etehi dhammehi dussamuṭṭhāpayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Because it’s hard to stimulate a sluggish mind with these things.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso parittaṃ aggiṃ ujjāletukāmo assa.
segments.en: Suppose someone wanted to make a small fire flare up.

segments.pli: So tattha allāni ceva tiṇāni pakkhipeyya, allāni ca gomayāni pakkhipeyya, allāni ca kaṭṭhāni pakkhipeyya, udakavātañca dadeyya, paṃsukena ca okireyya;
segments.en: If they toss wet grass, cow-dung, and timber on it, spray it with water, and scatter dirt on it,

segments.pli: bhabbo nu kho so puriso parittaṃ aggiṃ ujjāletun”ti?
segments.en: could they make it flare up?”

segments.pli: “No hetaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “No, sir.”

segments.pli: “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, yasmiṃ samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, akālo tasmiṃ samaye passaddhisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo samādhisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo upekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya.
segments.en: “In the same way, when the mind is sluggish, it’s the wrong time to develop the awakening factors of tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Līnaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ taṃ etehi dhammehi dussamuṭṭhāpayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Because it’s hard to stimulate a sluggish mind with these things.

segments.pli: Yasmiñca kho, bhikkhave, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, kālo tasmiṃ samaye dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, kālo vīriyasambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, kālo pītisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya.
segments.en: When the mind is sluggish, it’s the right time to develop the awakening factors of investigation of principles, energy, and rapture.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Līnaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ taṃ etehi dhammehi susamuṭṭhāpayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Because it’s easy to stimulate a sluggish mind with these things.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso parittaṃ aggiṃ ujjāletukāmo assa.
segments.en: Suppose someone wanted to make a small fire flare up.

segments.pli: So tattha sukkhāni ceva tiṇāni pakkhipeyya, sukkhāni gomayāni pakkhipeyya, sukkhāni kaṭṭhāni pakkhipeyya, mukhavātañca dadeyya, na ca paṃsukena okireyya;
segments.en: If they toss dry grass, cow-dung, and timber on it, blow on it, and don’t scatter dirt on it,

segments.pli: bhabbo nu kho so puriso parittaṃ aggiṃ ujjāletun”ti?
segments.en: could they make it flare up?”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “Yes, sir.”

segments.pli: “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, yasmiṃ samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, kālo tasmiṃ samaye dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, kālo vīriyasambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, kālo pītisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya.
segments.en: “In the same way, when the mind is sluggish, it’s the right time to develop the awakening factors of investigation of principles, energy, and rapture.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Līnaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ taṃ etehi dhammehi susamuṭṭhāpayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Because it’s easy to stimulate a sluggish mind with these things.

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye uddhataṃ cittaṃ hoti, akālo tasmiṃ samaye dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo vīriyasambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo pītisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya.
segments.en: When the mind is restless, it’s the wrong time to develop the awakening factors of investigation of principles, energy, and rapture.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Uddhataṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ taṃ etehi dhammehi duvūpasamayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Because it’s hard to settle a restless mind with these things.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso mahantaṃ aggikkhandhaṃ nibbāpetukāmo assa.
segments.en: Suppose someone wanted to extinguish a bonfire.

segments.pli: So tattha sukkhāni ceva tiṇāni pakkhipeyya, sukkhāni ca gomayāni pakkhipeyya, sukkhāni ca kaṭṭhāni pakkhipeyya, mukhavātañca dadeyya, na ca paṃsukena okireyya;

segments.pli: bhabbo nu kho so puriso mahantaṃ aggikkhandhaṃ nibbāpetun”ti?
segments.en: could they extinguish it?”

segments.pli: “No hetaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “No, sir.”

segments.pli: “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, yasmiṃ samaye uddhataṃ cittaṃ hoti, akālo tasmiṃ samaye dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo vīriyasambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo pītisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya.
segments.en: “In the same way, when the mind is restless, it’s the wrong time to develop the awakening factors of investigation of principles, energy, and rapture.

segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Uddhataṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ taṃ etehi dhammehi duvūpasamayaṃ hoti.

segments.en: When the mind is restless, it’s the right time to develop the awakening factors of tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

segments.en: Suppose someone wanted to extinguish a bonfire.

segments.en: could they extinguish it?”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “Yes, sir.”

segments.pli: “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, yasmiṃ samaye uddhataṃ cittaṃ hoti, kālo tasmiṃ samaye passaddhisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, kālo samādhisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, kālo upekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya.

segments.en: Why is that?

segments.en: Because it’s easy to settle a restless mind with these things.

segments.pli: Satiñca khvāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sabbatthikaṃ vadāmī”ti.
segments.en: But mindfulness is always useful, I say.”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Which awakening factors should be developed when the mind is tired, and which when it is energetic? And what is always useful?
